metadata.Title: CVE-2016-4472 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
The overflow protection in Expat is removed by compilers with certainoptimization settings, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial ofservice (crash) or possibly execute arbitrary code via crafted XML data.NOTE: this vulnerability exists because of an incomplete fix forCVE-2015-1283 and CVE-2015-2716.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-4472` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

expat - 2.1.0-4ubuntu1.2
lib64expat1 - 2.1.0-4ubuntu1.2
libexpat1 - 2.1.0-4ubuntu1.2
No subscription required

tla - 1.3.5+dfsg-15
No subscription required

criterions.comment: expat package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.1.0-4ubuntu1.2').
xmlrpc-c: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
vnc4: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
